turns.content:
Sure, here is an updated comprehensive page structure for all 24 pages:

1. Login Page:
* A login form that includes fields for entering a username and password
* A "Forgot Password" link that allows users to reset their password
* A "Sign Up" link that directs users to a registration page (if applicable)
* A "Remember Me" checkbox that allows users to stay logged in on the device
2. Dashboard:
* A summary of sales data, including total sales, sales by category, and sales by date range
* A summary of inventory levels, including total quantity, quantity by category, and low stock alerts
* A summary of customer information, including total number of customers, new customers by date range, and customer demographics
* A set of quick links to key areas of the system, such as sales, inventory, and customer management
3. Sales Page:
* A search bar and filter options to allow users to quickly find specific products
* A list view of products, including product name, image, price, and quantity in stock
* A shopping cart that displays the products selected for purchase and the total cost
* A checkout process that includes fields for entering customer information and payment details
* A "View Sales History" button that allows users to view past sales transactions
4. Inventory Page:
* A search bar and filter options to allow users to quickly find specific products
* A list view of products, including product name, image, price, and quantity in stock
* A "Add Product" button that allows users to add new products to the inventory
* A "Edit Product" button that allows users to edit existing products
* A "Delete Product" button that allows users to remove products from the inventory
5. Customer Management Page:
* A search bar and filter options to allow users to quickly find specific customers
* A list view of customers, including customer name, contact information, and purchase history
* A "Add Customer" button that allows users to add new customers
* A "Edit Customer" button that allows users to edit existing customer information
* A "Delete Customer" button that allows users to remove customers from the system
6. Reporting and Analytics Page:
* A set of pre-configured reports, such as sales by date range, inventory levels, and customer demographics
* A set of customizable charts and graphs that allow users to analyze data in different ways
* A "Download Report" button that allows users to export data in a spreadsheet format
* A "Save Report" button that allows users to save a report for future reference
7. Settings Page:
* A section for adjusting tax rates and payment options
* A section for managing user access levels and permissions
* A "Save Changes" button that allows users to save any changes made to the settings
* A "Reset to Default" button that allows users

to restore default settings

8. Help Page:
* A set of frequently asked questions (FAQs)
* A contact form that allows users to submit support requests
* A phone number and email address for contacting support
* A link to online documentation or user manual
* A link to a forum or community where users can ask and answer questions.
9. Tiered Pricing Page:
* A list view of different customer groups and their associated prices
* A "Add Group" button that allows users to create new pricing groups
* A "Edit Group" button that allows users to edit existing pricing groups
* A "Delete Group" button that allows users to remove pricing groups
10. Pricing History Page:
* A list view of past pricing changes, including the date, product, and new price
* A "Download History" button that allows users to export the pricing history in a spreadsheet format
* A chart or graph to visually display pricing trends over time
* A "Filter by Product" option to view pricing history for a specific product
* A "Filter by Date Range" option to view pricing history for a specific time period
11. Purchase Order/List Page:
* A list view of purchase orders and lists, including the customer, products, quantities, and

status

* A "Create Order" button that allows users to create a new purchase order
* A "Edit Order" button that allows users to edit existing purchase orders
* A "Delete Order" button that allows users to remove purchase orders
* A "View Order History" button that allows users to view past purchase orders
12. Logistics Page:
* A list view of logistics information, including shipping rates, delivery times, and tracking information
* A "Add Shipping Method" button that allows users to add new shipping options
* A "Edit Shipping Method" button that allows users to edit existing shipping options
* A "Delete Shipping Method" button that allows users to remove shipping options
13. Quote Request Page:
* A list view of quote requests, including the customer, product, and status
* A "Submit Request" button that allows users to submit a new quote request
* A "Edit Request" button that allows users to edit existing quote requests
* A "Delete Request" button that allows users to remove quote requests
* A "View Request History" button that allows users to view past quote requests
14. Dropshipping Page:
* A list view of products available for dropshipping, including product name, image, and details
* A "Add Product" button that allows users to add products to their own store under their own branding
* A "Edit Product" button that allows users to edit existing products
* A "Delete Product" button that allows users to remove products from their store
15. Product Categories Page:
* A list view of product categories, including category name and a sample of products within that category
* A "Filter by Category" option to view only products within a specific category
* A "View All Products" button that allows users to view all products in the system, regardless of category
16. Product Details Page:
* A detailed view of a specific product, including product name, image, description, specifications, and reviews
* A "Add to Cart" button that allows users to add the product to their shopping cart
* A "Add to Wishlist" button that allows users to save the product for later
* A "View Similar Products" button that allows users to view other products in the same category
17. Order Status Page:
* A page where users can view the status of their orders, including shipping and delivery information.
18. Product Comparison Page:
* A page where users can compare multiple products side by side to help with decision making.
19. Supplier Management Page:
* A page where users can view and manage information about suppliers, such as contact details, product offerings, and lead times.
20. Employee Management Page:
* A page where users can view and manage information about employees, such as roles, access levels, and performance metrics.
21. Credit Management Page:
* A page where users can view and manage customer credit limits and balances.
22. Promotion Management Page:
* A page where users can create, view and manage promotions, such as discounts and coupons.
